etymology.description: 屌(“dick”; vulgar; also ‘edgy/cool’ in slang) + 丝(“silk/thread”; internet-slang suffix from 粉丝 ‘fan’) = self-deprecating ‘loser/ordinary guy’.
etymology.interpretation: Self-mocking internet slang for ordinary or underprivileged young men, often contrasted with 高富帅. Tone ranges from humorous self-deprecation to insult depending on context.
etymology.simplification: 絲 was simplified to 丝 by streamlining the silk radical and reducing strokes; widespread online use favored the simplified form for faster typing.

parts.english: silk; thread; filament; fan (abbrev in 粉丝)

examples.chinese: 他自嘲自己是个屌丝(他自嘲自己是個屌絲)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zìcháo zìjǐ shì gè diǎosī.
examples.english: He jokingly calls himself a loser.

examples.chinese: 很多屌丝努力学习(很多屌絲努力學習)，希望改变命运(希望改變命運)。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō diǎosī nǔlì xuéxí, xīwàng gǎibiàn mìngyùn.
examples.english: Many diaosi study hard, hoping to change their fate.

examples.chinese: 有人把屌丝当作自我调侃(有人把屌絲當作自我調侃)，也有人觉得这是贬义词(也有人覺得這是貶義詞)。
examples.pinyin: Yǒurén bǎ diǎosī dāngzuò zìwǒ tiáokǎn, yě yǒu rén juéde zhè shì biǎnyìcí.
examples.english: Some people use diaosi as self-mockery, while others see it as a derogatory term.
